column4: I'd power down, remove batteries, remove cmos battery (if you can get to it), and let it chill a little bit
then the bios may be in better shape
desktop motherboards usually have a jumper for bios reset... but i know nothing about tablets
you could google the model number and find some stuff..
well gentlemen, for those of you who remember my question earlier about reinstalling all packages...i am doing it now...
any luck on the cmos battery?
should be accessible... a small panel maybe?
you may be grabbing the wrong file... which file you selecting with ndiswapper?
but I did try to compile the ubuntu zd1211 driver... not sure if it's conflicting but then I disabled it via modprobe -r zd1211
yes but only for 9x, ME etc - i chose the provided XP one (only three/four files)
yeah i tried all three files, it only accepts .inf but maybe i should do it via terminal?
hm then do you think it's a conflicting ubuntu driver - the zd1211 one?
once i've added to the blacklist, how do i update/refresh?
